title: electronicash
author: electronicash
content: the mandel fork for Antelope protocol for EOS will happen this Sept. 21 and this is backed by EOS Network, Telos, WAX and UX Network coalition to develop the Antelope protocol which is community based for the Web3 Framework unlike before which is only developed by blockone. this rebranding is waking up to token surge. i'm shilling of course after all there is thread for this one yet. not really sure if this could just be a brief rally or not. but i'm hoping this will bring more adoption to these altcoins. the development could probably put the project on the top 20 again on CMC.for anyone interested here is an introduction to Antelope https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H3PNP2O4TB4

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Quote from: electronicash on August 25, 2022, 02:40:03 AMthe mandel fork for Antelope protocol for EOS will happen this Sept. 21 and this is backed by EOS Network, Telos, WAX and UX Network coalition to develop the Antelope protocol which is community based for the Web3 Framework unlike before which is only developed by blockone. this rebranding is waking up to token surge. i'm shilling of course after all there is thread for this one yet. not really sure if this could just be a brief rally or not. but i'm hoping this will bring more adoption to these altcoins. the development could probably put the project on the top 20 again on CMC.for anyone interested here is an introduction to Antelope https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H3PNP2O4TB4Sad to say but EOS is dead. Forget about it. Its one of few tokens that are traded now way below 2018 bear market bottom. Yea previous cycle. BNB is now at 60x from 2018 bottom.What BNB did that justify 60x:1- bought CMC2- build most popular futures platform (5x more volume than second place - bybit)3- remains the biggest CEX (more volume than all others from top 10 all together)4- buld the biggest traffic smart contract platform (BSC) - 2 times more transaction per day than on ETH...9 - binance card10 - invested 200M in Forbes.Everything in only 4 years. What eos did in the same time? 1-No one use it2-everyone forgets about it3-is now doing a Antelope upgrade that also no one will care about just after update.

comments.author: Pterosaur
comments.body: EOS can still bring something to the table, yes we can't compare EOS to BNB but its good to see a project come back from the dead, since 2020 EOS is not the type of project I want to look into twice, I never liked it but maybe this is the beginning of something new for EOS, only time will tell.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: Pterosaur on August 25, 2022, 07:21:33 AMEOS can still bring something to the table, yes we can't compare EOS to BNB but its good to see a project come back from the dead, since 2020 EOS is not the type of project I want to look into twice, I never liked it but maybe this is the beginning of something new for EOS, only time will tell.I don't believe in the maxim that projects do come back from the dead, i might be completely wrong anyway, but i don't think it works, don't get me wrong, i am not talking about a project just merely plunging or depreciating in price, no one can consider that to be a dead project because every projects plunges at one time or the other, whilst the good ones appreciate again, and the ones that have no utility or are a scam coin never appreciate again.Thus having said that, when a coin/token/project is somewhat dead, with no demand, hype or development, no matter how hard the team behind the project tries to awaken the coin, it doesn't work, that is prolly the condition that EOS are in right now, you definitely can't be sure the token will come back to be useful, or if the hype they are currently creating now will last more than a few weeks or thereabout.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: the team experienced the worse of season, we have seen the manifestation thru its price how hard it plunges from its ath and it never breaks it during the bullrun of 2021. Larimer leaved like he did to his previous project and worse was that block.one turns out to be managed by assholes.why i believe it will succeed this time is because of the coalition of the communities to develop the new protocol. as for utility of the token, there are projects on EOS and remains in EOS despite what had happened. this will make EOS, Wax and Telos to perform well in smartcontract competition.

comments.author: Widdop37
comments.body: The team failed to deliver and now that's already too late they decide to make a come back? They must be out of their God damn minds, once you ruined the trust of your fans in crypto space you are done for, as big as Shiba inu community is right now if the team fumbled the price will tank and majority will leave.
